intro: Tetrapterys rotundifolia var. leptoptera, commonly known as the narrow-leaf velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically divided into five to seven lobes, and its small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. The plant is native to tropical regions of the Americas and thrives in moist, shady environments. It has a fibrous root system and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties.
